feed.title: Symantec Web Security Service Status - Incident History

entry.title: Network Maintenance in Tel Aviv (TLV1) Data Center December 18, 2019
entry.content:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Dec 18, 16:00 - 17:00 UTC

Dec 9, 19:40 UTC
Scheduled - Network maintenance will occur in our Tel Aviv (TLV1) data center on December 18, 2019, starting at 16:00 UTC, and is expected to last up to 1 hour.

Impact
There may be a brief outage during the maintenance window.

Required Action
IPSec connected customers are requested to bring up their secondary tunnel (if configured) prior to the maintenance.

Schedule
• Start Date: December 18, 2019, at 16:00 UTC
• End Date: December 18, 2019, at 17:00 UTC

entry.title: Authentication Errors when Logging in through SAML
entry.content:
Dec 10, 05:45 UTC
Resolved - We have confirmed the underlying issue impacting SAML authentication is resolved. This incident is now closed.

Dec 10, 03:51 UTC
Monitoring - As of 03:45 UTC, SAML authentication issues have been resolved. We continue to monitor the portal performance. We will provide additional updates as new information becomes available.

Dec 9, 23:54 UTC
Update - We are continuing to work on deployment of the fix. We will provide additional updates as new information becomes available.

Dec 9, 19:30 UTC
Identified - We have identified the issue impacting SAML authentication and working on deploying a fix. We will provide additional updates as new information becomes available.

Dec 9, 17:34 UTC
Investigating - We are aware some customers are encountering issues with SAML authentication. We are investigating the issue and will provide additional updates as new information becomes available.

Impacted users should consider temporarily disabling SAML “Sign Authentication Request” option in the portal, as a workaround while we work on resolving this incident. User can locate this option under Authentication>SAML.

entry.title: Web Security Service Maintenance Announcement
entry.content:
Dec 6, 23:59 UTC
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Dec 6, 23:58 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Nov 26, 19:42 UTC
Scheduled - As previously communicated on October 14, 2019, Symantec is performing a service-wide deployment of the Web Security Service release, which started on October 21, 2019, and is completing on December 6, 2019 at approximately 03:00 UTC.

Note: For a list of resolved issues that are included in this release, please review the release notes. Visit Symantec Status Symantec Status to sign up for periodic updates and sign up for notifications.

New Features and Enhancements

  • WSS Agent 6.1 supporting the upcoming Cloud Firewall Service release
  • Infrastructure updates to prepare for the upcoming Cloud Firewall Service release
  • SEP Agent for WSS: SAML authentication supported in all deployment models
  • WSS threat protection now includes controls for web-traffic on non-standard ports
  • UPE support for SGOSv7 reference devices with security policy templates and exemptions
  • DLP scanning policy updated with latest recommendations
  • Auth-Connector update improving service stability and monitoring

    Timing
    The maintenance window, which started on October 21, 2019, will complete on December 6, 2019. All maintenance will occur between 18:00 and 06:00 local data center time.

    Customer Impact
    The following describes what happens to connected clients, depending on the access method used:
  • Explicit proxy / Unified Agent / Proxy Forwarding: The service automatically redirects connections to other active resources within the same data center or geographic location. No customer action is required for failover to occur.
  • IPSec: A brief failover delay may occur as we redirect traffic to other active resources within the data center. No customer action is required for failover to occur.
  • During the last day of the maintenance window, administrators actively using the WSS Portal may need to re-authenticate.

    Service Impact
    This maintenance will be performed on all service components within the data center. These components will be upgraded in rotation, preserving service at each data center at all times.

    Note: There will be no change to access log format.

    Reporting Problems
    If you experience issues following this maintenance, contact Technical Support. Support information is located at https://support.symantec.com/en_US.html or on the main Web Security Service Portal page at https://portal.threatpulse.com/.

entry.title: Web Security Service Maintenance Announcement
entry.content:
Dec 6, 23:59 UTC
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Dec 6, 23:58 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Nov 11, 21:23 UTC
Update - The previously announced deployment communicated on October 14, 2019 has been extended to December 6, 2019.

For questions contact Technical Support. Support information located at https://support.symantec.com/en_US.html or on the main Web Security Service Portal page at https://portal.threatpulse.com/.

Oct 14, 15:40 UTC
Scheduled - Symantec will be conducting general maintenance to prepare for an upcoming release of the Web Security Service. During this maintenance event all services will remain operational and available.

Timing
The maintenance window will run from October 21, 2019, with an estimated completion date of November 15, 2019. All maintenance will occur between 18:00 and 06:00 local data center time.

Customer Impact
The following describes what happens to connected clients, depending on access method used:

  • Explicit proxy / Unified Agent / Proxy Forwarding: The service automatically redirects connections to active data pods within the same data center or geographic location. This is for information only, and the customer does not need to take any action.
  • IPSec: A short fail-over delay may occur as the load balancer directs traffic to another active data pod within the data center. This is for information only, and the customer does not need to take any action*.
    *The creation of a backup tunnel to another data center (if not already configured) prior to the deployment is recommended for customers connecting to Oslo and Tel Aviv.

    Reporting Problems
    If you experience issues following this maintenance, contact Technical Support. Support information is located at https://support.symantec.com/en_US.html or on the main Web Security Service Portal page at https://portal.threatpulse.com/.

    Please visit Symantec Status for periodic updates and to see other status of the Web Security Service.

Resolved - On December 6, 2019, between 01:26 and 01:42 UTC, customer connections to the Turin (TRN1) Data Center may have experienced decreased performance or disconnect from the service. This issue has been resolved, and normal connectivity restored.

entry.title: Turin (TRN1) Data Center Degraded Performance
entry.content:
Nov 26, 05:30 UTC
Resolved - We have confirmed the unplanned carrier maintenance is completed and Turin (TRN1) Data Center is now fully operational. This incident is resolved.

Nov 26, 03:03 UTC
Identified - We are aware that customers connecting via the Turin (TRN1) Data Center may experience degraded performance. We have identified the cause of this issue as unplanned carrier maintenance. The next update will be available at approximately 6:00 UTC or when new information becomes available.

entry.title: Tel Aviv (TLV1) Data Center Unavailable
entry.content:
Nov 18, 09:26 UTC
Resolved - We have confirmed the underlying issue is resolved. This incident is now closed.

Nov 18, 08:47 UTC
Monitoring - As of 08:41 UTC connectivity has been restored. We continue to monitor the data center performance. We will provide additional updates as new information becomes available.

Nov 18, 08:22 UTC
Identified - We have identified the root cause and are working towards full remediation. We will provide further updates as they become available.

Nov 18, 07:15 UTC
Investigating - The Tel Aviv (TLV1) data center is currently unavailable. We are investigating the issue and will provide additional updates as new information becomes available.

IPSec connected customers are requested to bring up their secondary tunnel (if configured) while we work towards resolving this incident.

entry.title: Third Party Certificate Maintenance November 9, 2019
entry.content:
Nov 10, 02:00 UTC
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Nov 9, 14:00 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Oct 11, 22:50 UTC
Scheduled - The vendor who provides certificates for client device enrollment (iOS, Android, and cert-based firewall) for the Web Security Service will be performing scheduled maintenance on November 9, 2019, starting 14:00 UTC for a duration of 12 hours.

Impact
This will impact the enrollment of new devices only. Devices that have already been enrolled will not be impacted.

Schedule
• Start Date: November 9, 2019, at 14:00 UTC
• End Date: November 10, 2019, at 02:00 UTC

entry.title: WSS CASB Gateway Interconnect Policy Distribution Failure
entry.content:
Oct 25, 19:30 UTC
Resolved - We have confirmed the underlying issue is resolved and there is no longer an impact to the CASB Gateway Interconnect. This incident is now closed.

Oct 25, 18:16 UTC
Identified - We have identified the cause of the issue impacting policies and are working to apply a fix. We will provide further updates as new information is discovered.

Oct 25, 17:55 UTC
Investigating - We are aware some customers may be experiencing issues where their CASB policies are not being applied to their traffic. We are investigating this issue with the highest priority and will provide further updates as new information is discovered.
